verses.name: Job 9:24
verses.text: The earth is given into the hand of the wicked: he covereth the faces of the judges thereof; if not, where, and who is he?

verses.name: Job 9:25
verses.text: Now my days are swifter than a post: they flee away, they see no good.

verses.name: Job 9:26
verses.text: They are passed away as the swift ships: as the eagle that hasteth to the prey.

verses.name: Job 9:27
verses.text: If I say, I will forget my complaint, I will leave off my heaviness, and comfort myself:

verses.name: Job 9:28
verses.text: I am afraid of all my sorrows, I know that thou wilt not hold me innocent.

verses.name: Job 9:29
verses.text: If I be wicked, why then labour I in vain?
